title: Roman Anthony played a big role getting the Red Sox get into playoff position. It’s on the veterans to play into October.
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Roman Anthony suffered a left oblique strain, likely sidelining him for 4-6 weeks during crucial playoff push.
The Red Sox, once 27-30 in late May, now hold a 98.1% chance of making the postseason.
Veterans like Trevor Story and Alex Bregman must step up in Anthony's absence to maintain playoff trajectory.

title: Review: ‘The Paper’ shows promise, even as ‘The Office’ legacy looms large
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Paper,' a spinoff of NBC's 'The Office,' is now streaming its first season on Peacock.
Oscar Nuñez from 'The Office' reprises his role as Oscar Martinez, linking the new show to its predecessor.
'The Paper' features a fictional newspaper struggling under corporate pressure and introduces new characters like editor Ned.

title: Randy Moss opened up about cancer battle, support he received, and helping Deion Sanders
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Randy Moss was diagnosed with Stage 2 bile-duct cancer in late 2024 and is now in remission.
Moss underwent a six-hour procedure, chemotherapy, and radiation to treat his cancer.
Moss supported Deion Sanders during his own cancer battle, reflecting on advice from his wife.

title: 2 young adults killed in midday N.H. crash
author: John Waller
bullets: Two young adults from Barrington were killed in a three-vehicle crash in Barrington, New Hampshire.
The crash involved two passenger vehicles and a commercial vehicle at Route 125 and Newtown Plains Road.
An 83-year-old woman involved in the crash was taken to the hospital with injuries.

title: Woman who ran over pedestrian at South Bay Mall had 15 used needles in handbag, authorities say
author: John Waller
bullets: Ariella Bezan, 25, charged with OUI drugs and negligence after hitting a pedestrian at South Bay Mall.
Authorities found 15 used needles and drug paraphernalia in Bezan's vehicle after the incident.
Victim sustained non-life-threatening injuries; Bezan's bail set at $1,500 with a drug program mandated.

title: Should we hope that Mike Vrabel’s debut as Patriots coach goes as well as Jerod Mayo’s did? Actually, yes.
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Vrabel debuts as Patriots coach against Raiders, aiming to match last year's opening win under Jerod Mayo.
Patriots feature promising players like rookie TreVeyon Henderson and tackle Will Campbell in season opener.
Raiders bring notable newcomers like coach Pete Carroll and running back Ashton Jeanty to face Patriots.

title: A Mass. historical home tour just ranked the best in the U.S.
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: The House of the Seven Gables in Salem ranked the best historical home tour in the U.S. by Newsweek.
The mansion inspired Nathaniel Hawthorne's 1851 novel and is one of the largest timber mansions on its original foundation.
The 45-minute tour highlights women's histories, Indigenous peoples, and immigrant communities, with admission priced at $25-$30.

title: 10 burning questions about the 2025 Patriots ahead of their season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: The 2025 Patriots enter a new era under coach Mike Vrabel with significant changes to their roster and strategies.
Quarterback Drake Maye, alongside Stefon Diggs, leads the new-look offense amid high expectations after a challenging 2024 season.
Key player concerns include injuries to Christian Gonzalez, rookie impacts, and the effectiveness of new defensive acquisitions.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge of recent Greater Boston news stories.
The quiz covers trending stories and is intended to keep residents informed.
General Assignment Editor Peter Chianca has been with Boston.com since 2019.

title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox place reliever Jordan Hicks on 15-day injured list with a shoulder injury.
Hicks, holding an 8.20 ERA, struggled in Boston's 8-1 loss to the Guardians Wednesday.
Chris Murphy expected to join Red Sox bullpen as Hicks recovers from his injury.
